name: BEST WESTERN Harborside Inn & Kenosha Conference Center

reviews.title: Frequent Guest
reviews.text: I'm from Kenosha and live out of town, but visit about 2x/year and always stay at the BW harborside. Overall, my wife and I are pleased with the rooms and service, great location. On the last visit just a few weeks ago I noticed there was a lot of noise, partying of college students is my guess. Access to the hotel through the side door is easy as the door is not locked and often wedged open. The management should fix these problems to keep my loyalty and improve the quality.

We were a bit hesitant based on latest reviews but took a chance and glad we did. Sneaky clean, pleasant and friendly staff and a fantastic harbor view. Highly recommended. The first floor is being renovated but that caused no problem at all.
reviews.title: Great clean hotel with spectacular views of harbor, priced right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a package deal with the Kenosha Marathon. The room was similar to the pictures. It was clean and comfortable. One bed was squeaky, the other wasn't. The mattresses were rather soft, but this is a personal preference. The whirlpool was a little short on whirl, but it was clean and hot.
reviews.title: Comfortable, could be more accommodating

reviews.text: Although many guests were there for the marathon, which started at 7 a.m. The desk said they could only "try" to get bananas, bagels, and beverages available before 7. "Maybe" is as good as "no" since we had to have a dependable source of breakfast and we were all walking to the race. (The dump we stayed in last year opened their full breakfast room at 5 for runners.) They would not allow us to check out even an hour late, but suggested that we shower in the pool area if we needed to after the race. The desk personnel the next day considered this crazy talk because checked out is checked out. With a little effort and no cost, they could have gotten a lot more goodwill.
reviews.title: In desperate need of a facelift!

reviews.text: We did see a vanload of Carthage students dropped off, but had no problems with noise or traffic, even though it was Friday night.
reviews.title: Walls to thin

reviews.text: this hotel has an awesome location right on the harbour with plenty of ships and restaurants close by. the good news is they are in midst of an upgrade. the bad news is their timing is off and they are focused on the wrong things. they are upgrading their pool and fitness area. they need to focus on their rooms.
reviews.title: wasted opportunity to shine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the first room we checked into had a musty smell and when I adjusted the a/c, the front grill of it fell off. we couldn't get it back on. the room also had a crappy view of the front street, so we asked for a new room. we decided to pay an extra $30 to upgrade to a harbour view room. much better view and newer a/c unit, but the double beds were in sad shape. every time my husband or I say down, the mattress would drop down about a foot, springs making popping noises. forced snuggling, but not the best night's sleep.
reviews.title: UNEXPECTED SCENIC LOCATION

reviews.text: the customer service attitude varied widely across shifts.
reviews.title: Average, has potential when upgraded

reviews.text: they do open the continual breakfast at 4 a.m. for fishermen, but the hot breakfast isn't served until 6:30 a.m.
reviews.title: Where's the pool,weight room

reviews.text: I likely would not stay here again.
reviews.title: The Location is Perfect

reviews.text: Older hotel- kind of musty smelling. Need renos but they are in the process of completing some, I believe. My parents had a "non-smoking" room that smelled terribly of smoke- they were given another room upon complaining. Breakfast was decent- standard continental fare. Pool is closed due to major renovations so my kids were very disappointed because they were talking about using the pool all the way to the hotel. This was not mentioned on the website when we booked. Wouldn't stay here again.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a romantic getaway. The Grill Games were in Kenosha, and it sounded different and fun. Although the motel is currently under renovation, which was inconvenient, I'd highly recommend a harbor view room if you go. It's a pretty scene and there are nice areas to walk and explore near the motel.
reviews.title: Get a harbor view room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights during a driving trip. The location was given good reviews by others and that's why I chose it. I did get a Harbor View room and the room was comfortable but had no fridge or microwave and no place to keep the cheese that I bought. The clerk upon check in demanded a $100 deposit that wasn't listed on the website and they need to let customers know that; they may choose to book elsewhere. The breakfast in the morning had no orange juice; the machine was broken. Likewise the indoor pool, and the parking lot was half taken up with heavy equipment. I have stayed in many a Best Western, and this experience was in the bottom two, the other being the Blakesley-Poconos location. Never again for either!
reviews.title: Skip This One

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Best Western Harborside is being renovated so we knew there would be some bumps. The staff seemed a little rattled at times. If some thing was askew they relied on It's being repaired. Our room on 3 was painted but the carpeted needed a cleaning, and the bath room sink stopper needed to be fixed. The breakfast was ok but not inspired.
reviews.title: Great view of lake.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great location and great price. room was very clean. The drapes let in too much light in the morning but a clip could fix that . I picked this location because it was near the Light house and it was next to a few bars and restaurants. It turned out to be very romantic . The hotel is under renovation but really wasn't an inconvenience.
reviews.title: great hotel for the price !!

reviews.text: This is an older hotel (formerly a Holiday Inn) that is being refurbished one floor at a time. If you want an updated room, ask for the first floor. Right now (July 2013) they are working on the indoor pool, so if having access to a pool is important to you, call to see if the pool is re-opened yet. The remaining 4 floors are truly in need of renovation - but the reason I stay here every time I am in Kenosha (2 or 3 times a year for family) is the LOCATION. I pay the additional cost for a Harborside room, and love the view of the harbor, the lighthouse built in 1888, and Lake Michigan just beyond. The hotel provides free Wi-fi and free breakfast (best features are make your own Belgian style waffle and famous Racine "Kringle" coffee cake.) Downside to the upper 4 floors prior to renovation - mattresses are serviceable but old, small box style TV, etc. but I love being in part of town while I am here! PS - don't miss Villa d'Carlo (Carl's Pizza) across the street! Thin crust, very tasty - I love the "Beverly's Favorite".
reviews.title: Location, location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've never left a hotel at 3:30 am but we did leave this one at that time last night. I could not sleep there. We checked in late and had to leave to go to fireworks so I really didn't have time to look at the bathroom. There was a slight layer of dust on the furniture but I attributed that to the renovation that is going on the first floor. No biggie there. We arrived back at the room at about midnight. I went into the bathroom to get ready for bed. It was very dirty. In fact, filthy. The toilet smelled of urine and was horribly dirty. The bathtub was dirty and the floor had dirt caked in the corners and needed a real scrubbing. It was disgraceful. I don't know who is cleaning these rooms but clearly there is no quality control measures practiced by management in relation to the upkeep of these rooms.
reviews.title: July 4th stay

reviews.text: I tried to go to sleep, woke up at about 3am and had what I'd call the "heebie jeebies" about sleeping in that room. And quite frankly, the urine smell wafting from the bathroom was nauseating me. My husband was restless too so he said, let's just leave. So we did and slept when we arrived home. If we go up to Kenosha next year, we will definitely stay somewhere else. I don't think it's a lot to ask to have a bathroom that is somewhere in the vicinity of clean. Not even close.
reviews.title: Great views of the Harbor

reviews.text: I stayed here twice in the month of March 2013. First stay my room was very outdated but clean with great view of the Harbor. The second visit I got upgraded to a new remodeled room, boy what a difference in the two rooms. Breakfast food is free with stay and above average, everyone was very nice at the front desk. Indoor pool was small and hot tub was not working. Conference Center located at the hotel would have been vice for business travel. Walking distance to good food and views of harbor.
reviews.title: Quiet

aka: Best Western Harborside Inn And Kenosha Conference Center
description: Our unique downtown Kenosha, Wisconsin hotel is ideally located on the beautiful shores of Lake Michigan between Milwaukee and Chicago. Best Western Harborside Inn and Kenosha Conference Center is ideal for family adventures, romantic getaways and business travels alike.Best Western Harborside Inn and Kenosha Conference Center is Kenosha's only lakefront hotel and is conveniently located to several Kenosha attractions and businesses
